numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy applicants have a significant advantage in the college admissions process at elite colleges.
2. Some applicants apply without a legacy status to elite colleges.
3. A legacy applicant to an elite college is 7 times more likely to be admitted if the income of the parents is higher than the 90th percentile.
4. There is a dip in the graph for non-legacy applicants whose parents have an income around the 70th percentile.
5. Parents with a relatively low income are in a poorer income rank.
6. Non-legacy applicants with parents in a poorer income rank were 2 times as likely to be admitted.
7. For non-legacy applicants, the poorer extreme income rank and the richer extreme income rank almost reached the same likelihood of admission.
8. I wonder why the poorer extreme income rank and the richer extreme income rank almost reached the same likelihood of admission for non-legacy applicants.
9. I wonder how the graph would appear for each elite college separately.
10. I wonder which elite college favors legacy applicants the most.
12. Many of my classmates are seniors.
13. My classmates and I are going through the college admissions process.
14. The graph relates to my community.
15. I wonder how money will affect the admissions of my classmates to certain colleges.
16. I wonder how legacy status will affect the admissions of my classmates to certain colleges.
17. The headline is: Are elite colleges truly for elite students or for the elite?
